result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Matthew J Howard in court.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he is not eligible for Public Defender. He is applying for court-appointed counsel. 
Matthew Klug appears by video, is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zima. He is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 5/22/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Marshfield because the defendant believed there were people in his house. They left the residence and then later returned. He observed that defendant was acting strangely and he felt he was under the influence of a controlled substance. Defendant admitted to another officer that he had used methamphetamine. A white crystal substance was found on a mirror and drug paraphernalia was found in the residence. The substance tested positive for methamphetamine. A vape cartridge was also found in the residence and and the substance inside tested positive for THC. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
Attorney Zima asks Court take judicial notice of Langlade County case 12CF4, a prior drug conviction.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Court finds defendant is not eligible for court-appointed counsel.
Arraignment scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement
